So what I did when I had to create my own business, I hired somebody to give me “the constant push.” I got the services of MySuccess.Team. My coach, Braxton Yoeman, was not much of a drill sergeant but he does have his ways of making me do what I ought to. And the best thing about it? I kinda learned to like running a business a lot more because of him.

article: I'm a wounded veteran and having difficulties leaving my home, so when I first heard about an opportunity to start a business working from home I was naturally intrigued. I was skeptical as I've heard about many of these "business opportunities" and most of them are worthless and are only there to take your money and give you nothing in return. But I decided to take a leap of faith and try it out. At the beginning it wasn't easy.. I am not very computer-literate and never did any web stuff before, so the idea of me creating an online business was really out of my comfort zone. Also, it took almost a week until I got in touch with my coach Braxton as he was fully booked back then. However after a week as soon as we had our first call, I knew I was in good hands. I still had my doubts and thought I could never make it work. But my coach Braxton never gave up on me and kept motivating me and providing his guidance whenever I needed some support... and lo and behold, fast forward 2 months later and I actually have my very own internet site and a real business attached to it. I can't thank you enough Braxton! I can now work from the comfort of my home, on my own hours, whenever I want to. I could have never done it without you. Tears come to my eyes when I just think about it. I'm truly blessed to have come across you.
replies: Dear Glen,We are incredibly grateful that you took the time to leave us this feedback. article: When I was tasked to head my first big IT project for my company, I wanted to do everything right and not come across as a complete noob among other project heads. I did have a higher-ranking officer that I answer to and I’m free to ask him for guidance. But he has a hundred of other things going and there so much bandwidth he could reasonably devote to mentoring me. So I got myself the next best thing. I got a business coach and he’s from MySuccess Team. The coach didn’t come from my industry but it didn’t matter because I didn’t need help with the technical stuff. What I needed was someone to help me clarify my own plan and objective and help me follow-thru with my own deliverables, tasks that the coach from MySuccess Team brilliantly carried-out. My plan worked. The project was completed in time and it was graded as a success. All thanks to MySuccess Team.

article: If you’ve been with the same company for decades, doing whatever it is you’re doing day-in and day-out, everything becomes stale and you’ll just start losing touch. I call it droning on the job. Yes, you can use that catchphrase. You’re welcome. Same thing happened to me. I started hating my job. I didn’t want to quit, the job paid well. But it didn’t want to be miserable at work either. I just miss being emotionally invested in my career, or at least mentally involved. That’s what I felt until I got a little refresher program from MySuccess.team. It’s business coaching, they call it. It was like therapy for worn-out management executives. It’s like having a personal bartender on whom you can dump the worries of your day, except that bartender has a masters in business development and strategic planning (I’m sure some actual bartenders have). Anyway, it works, not overnight, and effects don’t last forever, but I now get it occasionally.
